Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies whether the electronic VAT declaration feature is enabled.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the URL to connect to ID-Porten.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the URL to login to ID-Porten.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the URL to validate VAT return.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the URL to exchange the access token with the Altinn token.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the URL for the submission environment.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the URL for the submission app.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies to disable checks when user clicks Release in the VAT return. Use this option when you are sure that checks are not correct.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Opens the OAuth 2.0 setup for the current user.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: This guide helps you to set up the integration with the ID-Porten and use the Skatteetaten API to submit VAT returns.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Welcome to the setup of Electronic VAT submission.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Set up the connection to the ID-Porten to use the Skatteetaten API.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Check your authorization status. If your status is Authorized, choose Next. If you are not authorized and have not yet specified the client ID and the client secret, choose Open Electronic VAT Setup. Then click the Status below to open the OAuth 2.0 setup page and use the Authorize action to complete the process.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Opens the Electronic VAT Setup to specify client ID and client secret.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Opens the OAuth 2.0 setup page where you can specify the data and authorize.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Make sure your VAT codes are ready for reporting.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Opens the list of missing VAT codes.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: One or more required codes does not exist. Click Show Codes to see missing codes. Click Add Codes to add missing codes.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies how many VAT codes are marked to report VAT Rate.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Updates the VAT codes that are required to report VAT rate and assigns the relevant VAT rate.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Some of the VAT codes must be set up to also report the VAT rate. Choose Update to make sure all the VAT codes are ready for reporting.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Opens the VAT posting setup page.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the name of the template.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the name for the new VAT statement.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Creates the VAT statement with required VAT codes.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Create a VAT statement with all required VAT codes. Make sure that VAT codes are specified in the VAT posting setup in advance. Select the template name, specify the name of the VAT statement and click Create VAT statement. If you do not want to create a VAT statement, click Next.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: You're ready to create and submit VAT returns.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: The Electronic VAT submission setup is complete.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the VAT rate to report.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies whether the VAT rate value must be reported.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the unique reference of the submission attempt.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the number to identify the payment.

Properties.Name: ObsoleteReason
Properties.Value: Use the table "VAT Reporting Code" instead.

Properties.Name: ObsoleteReason
Properties.Value: Use the table "VAT Reporting Code" instead.
